As I wrote last September, when Keith Vaz , the Labour chairman of Commons home affairs select committee, was upping the ante, Andy Coulson 's antagonists seem to be forging a new and frankly preposterous politico-legal doctrine of executive responsibility: namely, that a man should not only lose the job he holds at the time of the wrongdoing, but all subsequent jobs. On this sinister basis, one strike and you are out- forever. Andy Coulson has now lost two very senior positions in less than four years without a single allegation against him having been proved. - Senator says wounded US lawmaker` doing great' Senator Kirsten Gillibrand said Sunday that the US lawmaker shot in the head in Arizona last week "is doing great" and making progress every day. An autographed portrait of Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords at a makeshift memorial outside the hospital in Tucson, Arizona, on January 10. Senator Kirsten Gillibrand said Sunday that the US lawmaker shot in the head in Arizona last week "
answer_q: friend of Democratic congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords , has visited the lawmaker in her hospital room and is in close contact with her astronaut husband Mark Kelly, she told NBC's`` Meet The Press.'' Gabrielle Giffords is making progress every day. She's using both sides of her body. She's able to breathe on her own. She's able to open her eyes and to show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing, Kirsten Gillibrand said.`` It's an extraordinary amount of progress for a woman who sustained such a horrific injury,'' she added. The 40-year-old Gabrielle Giffords has survived despite being shot through the head
